item.media:title: Flash floods submerge cars around Fort Lauderdale Airport: a warning to travelers
item.media:description:
Fort Lauderdale, FL - As heavy rain poured down on Fort Lauderdale on the evening of April 13th, flash floods quickly overwhelmed the streets, submerging cars and causing chaos for drivers around the city, particularly around Fort Lauderdale Airport.
One witness, who goes by the username @TravelLoveFash on social media, captured the harrowing scenes on camera while driving around the airport. In the footage, cars can be seen floating in the flash, muddy waters. Although the floods are not severe, one should take caution.
The author of the video, @TravelLoveFash, has since shared their footage on social media, urging travelers to reconsider their travel plans and potentially rebook their flights. With more rain forecast in the coming days, it's essential for anyone planning to travel to Fort Lauderdale to take note of these dangerous conditions and plan accordingly. Credit to: @TravelLoveFash

item.media:title: Up close and personal with mount Merapi: volcanic activity in Klaten, Central Java
item.media:description:
On March 15, 2023, a video was recorded in the Indonesian province of Central Java, showing Mount Merapi, one of the world's most active volcanoes. The footage was captured by a man named @pradit.cahyadi, who intentionally positioned himself near the monitoring post of the mountain to capture the stunning scene.
Mount Merapi, located on the border of the provinces of Central Java and Yogyakarta, has a long history of eruptions, with the most recent occurring in 2018. The volcano is constantly monitored by a team of experts and instruments to provide early warnings to the surrounding population.
The video taken by @pradit.cahyadi shows a close-up view of the crater of the mountain, with lava and ash spewing out of it. The footage captures the raw power and beauty of nature as the volcano continues to erupt. While it is an incredible sight to see, it is important to remember the potential danger that a volcano presents.

item.media:title: Verkhnee Sancheleevo flood: girl’s journey to work through water!
item.media:description:
On March 13th, 2023, in the village of Verkhnee Sancheleevo, Samara, Russia, a girl left her house to work and walked straight through deep water. In a video posted by @thorzhevskaya_tlt, the girl can be seen braving the floodwaters that had surrounded her home from three sides.
The flood was caused by a nearby lake that had overflowed its banks due to heavy rainfall. The Ministry of Emergency Situations was on site for three days to help with the situation. Despite their efforts, water entered the girl’s house in the kitchen and completely flooded the bathhouse and guest house.
Thankfully, the water has now receded and everything is dry. The girl and her family were able to weather the flood and come out on the other side.

item.media:title: Piura province flooded after intense rainfall: rains in Máncora trigger devastating floods
item.media:description:
Piura City, Piura Province, Peru - On April 2nd, 2023, Piura Province was hit by a severe flood caused by intense rainfall. The rains were triggered by the summer storm in Máncora, a popular tourist destination in the area. The heavy downpour lasted for about an hour and a half, causing three ravines to be activated after almost 25 years. The current devastated everything in its path, blocking roads, and leaving hundreds of travelers stranded.
The Cabo Blanco ravine, also known as 'La Pepa', was one of the three ravines that were activated, causing severe damage. The torrential rain caused flooding in the area, and trucks were taken away by the current. The La Cruz district highway was completely blocked, forcing hundreds of travelers to walk to reach their destination.
The flooding caused by the activation of the ravines has affected several districts in Piura Province. Families and tourists who were enjoying the beaches and the summer in Máncora were surprised by the fall of huaicos that caused flooding after the streams nearby were activated. The situation was dire, with the water current blocking roads and leaving people stranded.

item.media:title: Riding in a tractor bucket: the scary yet ingenious way to cross a flooded river in Penza, Russia
item.media:description:
Spring flooding can often cause unexpected problems for communities, and the residents of one village in the Penza region of Russia recently found themselves facing an unusual challenge. Due to the high waters caused by the local river's spill, a hundred meters of the road became submerged and turned into a turbulent stream. This made it difficult for locals to get across, but they came up with an ingenious solution - crossing the stream in the bucket of a wheeled tractor.
Eyewitnesses admit that the method of crossing the stream looks rather scary, but people simply have no other option to get home. Several people get into the bucket, it rises, and the tractor starts moving across the stream. The tractor driver must navigate the swirling waters and ensure that everyone reaches the other side safely.
Although it might seem dangerous, judging by the frames of the published video, the tractor driver coped with the difficult task quite well. The "passengers" were delivered safe and sound to the other "shore". This shows the resilience and resourcefulness of people in the face of unexpected challenges.

item.media:title: Driving Through a Winter Wonderland: Massive Snowfall Blankets Homewood, California
item.media:description:
Homewood, California has been hit by a massive snowstorm, with some locations receiving several feet of snow over the last several days. According to reports, one location even received almost 10 feet of snow.
In a video shared on social media on March 5, 2023, @macphail_haley can be seen driving her car from her house through a huge layer of snow. In the video, Haley exclaims "Leaving Homewood this morning. WHEW!" as she navigates the snowy streets.

item.media:title: 120mph Wind and Snow at the Top of KT22 Chairlift in Tahoe
item.media:description:
Shot on February 28, 2023, at the top of KT22 chairlift in Tahoe, this video showcases the extreme conditions that skiers and snowboarders can face.
In the video, you can see the snow and wind whipping around Martin as he tries to capture the stunning scenery. With gusts up to 120mph, it's a wonder he was able to keep his footing, let alone film.

item.media:title: Stunning 2-Hour Timelapse of Northern Lights over Ardrossan and Saltcoats
item.media:description:
On the night of Sunday, February 26th, 2023, residents of Ardrossan and Saltcoats in Scotland were treated to a stunning display of the Northern Lights. The aurora activity was particularly intense, lasting for a full two hours and providing a breathtaking show for those lucky enough to witness it.
One person who did get to see the show was @DynamicScotland, who captured the beauty of the Northern Lights in a stunning timelapse video. The video shows the vivid colors of the aurora dancing across the sky, illuminating the darkness with an otherworldly glow. It's clear that @DynamicScotland had a front-row seat to one of nature's most incredible spectacles.
In fact, @DynamicScotland notes that this was the most vivid display of the Northern Lights they had seen in years, visible even to the naked eye. It's no wonder that they describe it as an "absolutely incredible show".

item.media:title: Northern Lights Time Lapses on British Airways Flight from Billund to London
item.media:description:
On a recent flight from Billund, Denmark to London, passengers were treated to a stunning display of the Northern Lights. The breathtaking view was captured by passenger Ben Applin, who managed to get some incredible time lapses despite the challenges of filming on a plane.
The display of the Northern Lights, also known as Aurora Borealis, is a rare and beautiful phenomenon that can only be seen in certain parts of the world. Passengers on the British Airways flight were lucky enough to witness this natural wonder from the comfort of their seats.
In a tweet, Ben Applin thanked the pilot for dimming the cabin lights to allow passengers to enjoy the stunning view. The time lapses he captured are a testament to his skill as a photographer, and serve as a reminder of the awe-inspiring power of nature.
The Northern Lights are caused by the interaction of charged particles from the sun with the Earth's magnetic field. This creates a stunning display of colorful lights in the sky, which is visible in certain parts of the world during certain times of the year.

item.media:title: Timelapse Captures Storm Rolling In Moments Before EF2 Tornado Strikes Norman
item.media:description:
On the night of February 27th, 2023, a series of severe thunderstorms and tornadoes barreled through Kansas and Oklahoma. One of these tornadoes, confirmed as an EF2, struck Norman, Oklahoma's third-largest city. Fortunately, despite the damage and destruction caused by the tornado, there were no reported fatalities.
A timelapse video captured the storm rolling in moments before the tornado struck. The video was taken at the intersection of Hwy 9 and Jenkins Avenue in Norman. The footage shows the ominous clouds and darkening skies that preceded the violent storm.
The tornado caused significant damage in Norman, including power outages, downed trees and power lines, and damage to homes and businesses. At least 12 people were injured in the storm, but none of the injuries were critical. Emergency responders and volunteers quickly worked to clear debris and restore power to affected areas.

item.media:title: An avalanche hit the mountain resorts, knocking out three skiers in Russia
item.media:description:
On February 20, 2023, between the Alpika resorts of the GTZ Gazprom and Rosa Khutor, there was an avalanche in the mountains of Sochi, Russia. The incident was caught on camera by eyewitnesses and posted online. Local residents reported that the avalanche also demolished a power line pylon.
Thankfully, there were no casualties reported as a result of the avalanche. However, a snow cannon was destroyed, and the protective mesh was damaged. The fence and communications on the bobsleigh track along the mudflow allotment were also broken.
In the second video, another incident happened: a group of skiers had a close call with an unexpected avalanche at the Laura ski resort, also in Sochi, Russia. The incident occurred as the skiers were taking a break under the roof of a local bar, following a successful run down the mountain.
A layer of snow that had been building up on the roof suddenly rolled off and covered the three people inside. The skiers were caught off guard and did not have time to react before being buried under the snow. Thankfully, eyewitnesses and employees of the ski resort were quick to react and rushed to the scene with shovels to dig out the buried skiers.
Fortunately, the skiers buried in the avalanche were not injured and were quickly handed over to doctors for a general examination. All people who go to mountainous areas should take this as a warning to be ready for anything and to stay alert at all times.
The incident serves as a stark reminder of the unpredictability of nature and the dangers that can arise in mountainous regions. While it had been snowing for three days in the Sochi mountains, a sudden change in weather conditions led to a sharp warming, causing avalanches to descend at an altitude of more than 500 meters above sea level.

item.media:title: A man was trying to walk on an icy road in Portland
item.media:description:
Winter weather can be beautiful, but it can also make getting around a challenge. That was the case for @e.boudreau and her fiance on December 23, 2022, when a snowstorm hit Portland, Oregon. They had plans to go out to brunch that morning, but the slippery roads made it clear that it was not safe to venture out.
She was adamant about staying inside, but her fiance was more optimistic. He thought that the roads would be fine and wanted to check for himself. She filmed him going outside and trying to go down, but the pathway is slippery. When he was trying to back up the hill, it was so funny that he was trying his best to walk on an icy road. As it turned out, she was right. The roads were treacherous, and her fiance quickly realized that they wouldn't be able to leave the house.

item.media:title: Footage of Storm Otto causing havoc on the North Sea
item.media:description:
On February 17, 2023, a powerful storm named Otto wreaked havoc on the North Sea, causing rough conditions for ships sailing in the area. The storm hit Norway and Europe, causing distress and concern for those out at sea.
One individual, John Buchan, captured footage of the storm from his fishing vessel, located 60 miles off the west coast of Norway. The video shows the immense power of the storm as it caused waves to crash violently against the ship.
The North Sea is no stranger to severe weather, but the impact of Storm Otto was particularly significant. The storm's high winds and heavy rain caused dangerous conditions for those at sea and onshore.

item.media:title: A man is saved from drowning in floods in Indonesia
item.media:description:
On January 29, 2023, Manado, Indonesia, was hit by severe flooding that affected 40 locations in 25 urban villages. The Manado Regional Disaster Management Agency (BPBD) reported that nine of these villages were also impacted by landslides and fallen trees, adding to the already disastrous situation.
Amid the chaos and destruction caused by the floods, a heart-stopping moment was captured on video by @cewebumi00. The video shows a man struggling to stay afloat in the floodwaters. Fortunately, the man was saved in the nick of time as rescuers reached him with a piece of wood, pulling him to safety. The video shows the relief and gratitude of the man as he is rescued, and according to sources, he is now doing fine.
The BPBD has been working tirelessly to evacuate residents from the affected areas and provide them with food, shelter, and other basic necessities. The Indonesian government has also activated its disaster response plan and deployed troops to assist with rescue and relief efforts.
It is not yet clear what caused the flooding, but heavy rainfall in the region in recent days is believed to have contributed to the disaster. The Indonesian meteorological agency has issued a warning to residents to remain vigilant as further heavy rainfall is expected in the coming days.
The people of Manado are in dire need of help, and the government and aid organizations are working together to provide the support they need. This rescue serves as a reminder of the bravery and determination of those working to save lives in the face of such disasters.

item.media:title: Luminous pillars appeared in the sky over Belgorod
item.media:description:
4 October 2022, Belgorod, Russia
This is a common atmospheric phenomenon - but it has led to rumors about the use of "the latest weapons."
Due to the fact that Belgorod is located near the border with Ukraine, speculation began to appear on social networks that this could be somehow connected with the war. In recent months, glows and flashes have been repeatedly observed over the city - basically, they were associated with the work of air defense.
The Phobos Weather Center explained that what had happened was just an ordinary atmospheric phenomenon called a halo - a secondary glow around a light source. A sun pillar is one of the most common types of halo. It is formed due to the refraction of light in ice crystals suspended in the air, and can be observed in winter damp calm weather when the Sun is at a certain angle to the horizon, or when there is a bright source of light on the earth.
